title: More Bits from Blinkbonny. ... Second edition
author: Strathesk, John
snippet: the one had been known to see the other Jwme and back again to the " Black Bull Inn," their " howff" at Blinkbonny, regardless of the extra thirty miles at furious speed which they took out of their mettle ponies, for so their undersized roadsters were called.

title: The Private Memoirs and Confessions of a Justified Sinner
author: Hogg, James
snippet: They did so; and it appears from what follows that the house, to which they retired must have been somewhere on the opposite side of the street to the Black Bull Inn, a little farther to the eastward. They had not been an hour in that house till some altercation chanced to arise between George Colwan and a Mr. Drummond, the younger son of a nobleman of distinction.

title: Reminiscences
author: Carlyle, Thomas
snippet: This of the Bullers was the product for me of Irviug's first months in London, begun and got under way in the spring aud summer of 1822, which followed our winter parting in the Black Bull Inn. I was already getting my head a little up ; translating " Legendre's Geometry " for Brewster ; my outlook somewhat cheerfuller.

title: Reminiscences
author: Carlyle, Thomas
snippet: It was not till late in autumn 1823, nearly two years after our parting in the Black Bull Inn, that I fairly, and to a still memorable measure, saw Irving again. He was on his marriage jaunt, Miss
